notes.title: Angular Material
notes.content: Angular Material is a User Interface (UI) component library that developers can use in their Angular projects to speed up the development of elegant and consistent user interfaces

notes.title: HTML
notes.content: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the code that is used to structure a web page and its content.

notes.title: CSS
notes.content: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to style and layout web pages â€” for example, to alter the font, color, size, and spacing of your content, split it into multiple columns, or add animations and other decorative features.

notes.title: Route Guard
notes.content: Angular's route guards are interfaces which can tell the router whether or not it should allow navigation to a requested route.

notes.title: Guard Use
notes.content: The Angular router's navigation guards allow to grant or remove access to certain parts of the navigation. Another route guard, the CanDeactivate guard, even allows you to prevent a user from accidentally leaving a component with unsaved changes.
